documents.document: Just seen the NZ V Aus ODI. Flippin heck. Josh Hazelwood, how could you? #stoinis
This is still my favourite cheating in cycling story. https://t.co/Kbg4LcpgRE
Had some car battery problems today. @Ask123ie sent an engineer out who got us running and couldn't have been any more helpful. Thankyou!
@Ell2309 @dangerhere They used to say "look away now" and put the results on screen for a few seconds without reading them out. Seriously.
@defensivelob I'd say that's quite a list, Joe.
@KathyBurke @defensivelob I loved that. "Hear, hear!" You were always in safe hands with John Hurt.
@rorymacm I think it might have been one rainy morning at Saturday school. Yes, we had Saturday school then.
@rorymacm I remember they sat us down in school, in the main hall, to watch a tape of that whole match. That was long before VHS.
@Vergilsbanter Good man. Must admit I was concentrating more on events on India.
@OwensDamien Is it Ed Balls day yet?
@Vergilsbanter Were you at the cricket today?
@Irelandcricket Is there a recommended/suggested area of the ground where Ireland supporters will gather?
So it's not the final table but someone at @SkySportsRugby needs to slow down and review this graphic. https://t.co/5ZQr2XOiZZ
The grown-ups are checking his tweets and deleting the ones that are a bit too embarrassing. https://t.co/QBPyaw6fTC
@OvalDigest I never knew Leavy went to Michael's too.
@HarpinOnRugby You're welcome. I had it in my diary for Saturday too. Always enjoy your blog - thanks!
@HarpinOnRugby I think the Leinster 'A' game is tonight at 7.30pm.
Wimbledon did the best vines. https://t.co/FSvcmyz3yF
Well done to @Gonzagadublin winning the senior league today. Great effort by all involved. #greenmachine https://t.co/nhrcxnV2W9
@MiguelDelaney That's @mrdanwalker. Surely?
Not sure about some of the choices made in the data visualisation accompanying this article in @IrishTimesSport. https://t.co/RJUOMFQ7cq
"Shane Long doesn't score enough goals but he has a heart the size of a barn door." Dunno if Lawro does these on purpose but that's genius.
The thing that amazes me about this UK ambassador to the EU story is that the UK has an ambassador to the EU.
@donal2608 @defensivelob Twitter itself is enough of a Donald tweet watch. No need to follow, unless you really want to.
@donal2608 I'm ignoring even the question.
It's an interesting one but your version could just as easily mean that Sean's Mum thinks my child is overweight. https://t.co/l1vopmarkZ
And now that it's dark you can also see Mars on the opposite side of the moon. Look carefully and it appears reddis… https://t.co/5tO8bI9DtI
A beautiful clear sky over Dublin this evening, with the two brightest objects in the night sky side by side: the moon and Venus.
@defensivelob The fire lit, a glass of wine and the kids all gone out to parties. There are worse ways to see in the new year. HNY!
@donal2608 @EoinAMcCarthy @oliverobrien I will never get past O my good it's good to be alive.
@donal2608 @oliverobrien Wake up, Donal, I think this must be it.
@larduffy I always preferred 10cc.
@larduffy I only speak Marion Cotillard. Il y a du monde au balcon. #chakakhan #hootenanny
Not sure they've captured the essential Black Bettyness of the original. #hootenanny
@oliverobrien @donal2608 We better wait up, Donal, to find out what the hit was.
I see they got the bloke on the drums again who looks a bit like Colin Montgomerie. #hootenanny
Gregory must be roasting inside that hat. #hootenanny
@oliverobrien Seasick Steve seems to have picked up a buddy since last year.
Apart from kickoffs they hardly got out of their own half. And that was with the wind. https://t.co/Ut8BGkQd5M
Here. This will save you watching any more of those year in review programmes over the next week or so. https://t.co/ejvWXT5coC
@theovaloffice10 You're clearly a man who knows a thing or two.
I hope everyone remembers what happened the last time Leinster demolished Northampton over there. That must not happen again.
Next time you're walking in Herbert Park, try to imagine what it was once like... https://t.co/AmwtuueGxp
"I saved that dog." Who'd have thought Christy Keane was a PG Wodehouse fan.
@EoinAMcCarthy Possibly. There's an awful lot of football in those sports pages as well.
OK, own up tennis fans. Which of you was it? https://t.co/Y9ZFYh6Y9p
@phlaimeaux Did Ronnie show his medal?
On #MOTD2 they just went through 6 of 7 goals in the Bournemouth-Liverpool game, except Origi's which was the most amazing piece of skill.
That pass wasn't as forward as the one to Jack Conana couple of minutes earlier. #LeinsterRugby
Tubs is already on his way to the Eye & Ear to have that eye seen to. #LateLateShow
@EoinAMcCarthy The champ won that one very convincingly.
@EoinAMcCarthy They do sometimes. Or just offering a solemn handshake will suffice too.
@defensivelob The Russian resigned because his position was hopeless and he was nearly out of time too.
@EoinAMcCarthy Oh you're right. I didn't read the rules as carefully as you. Carlsen has white in the 4th game and will park the bus.
Although rather a shame the tie break didn't reach the Armageddon stage. #worldchess2016
Well, that was an exciting finish. Well done Magnus Carlsen. #worldchess2016
@EoinAMcCarthy The browser widget is very good. Looks best on a desktop.
@EoinAMcCarthy The Russian has used up a lot of his time over his last few moves.
@EoinAMcCarthy A shame the stream isn't on TV or freely available on the internet. Could have been tremendous for promoting the game.
@EoinAMcCarthy World chess admin has always been dodgy. It's one of its charms.
@defensivelob @EoinAMcCarthy It seems they have a paywalled video stream. There is a live chess page here: https://t.co/4VtFqtZwmV
Tie-break in the world chess championship. I remember the Karpov-Kasparov match in 1984 which went on for months a… https://t.co/FQorRmNdNN
@gags_junior Hi Emma! Thanks for that, very interesting. I quite enjoy what @TheSchoolOfLife do. Plenty of helpful insights.
@Teroid If Israel Folau hadn't butchered a 3 on 1 overlap, it would have ended differently.
I'd have put Garry Ringrose in charge of my crèche. https://t.co/GWJys7f2Rg
Ringrose, along with Conor Murray, looked like the only thing holding our makeshift backline together in the second… https://t.co/RK08AV8qIM
Our backline in that second half could only have been more makeshift if we'd had Peter O'Mahony on the other wing.
If we can put a back line behind that pack we'll have a decent team. #irevaus
@noflashingneon Maybe it's to distinguish them. "Saint Thomas? Which one?" Is there another St Laurence?
@rocshot James's St, general area of?
Amazing. That's one of their second rows so detached from the scrum that he dives into the back of our scrum to kil… https://t.co/qVbPR1tPZL

"It was a knock on, ref."
No try. Scrum. ...
"IT WAS A DELIBERATE KNOCK ON."
#IREvNZL
I think Janko is my favourite hapless Austrian footballer. #AUSvIRE
@defensivelob @FrankmcnallyIT Highly irresponsible.
@Irelandcricket Yay, go @rocshot !! Well deserved.

Wales should stand in the shape of a poppy while their opponents do the haka.
What? They're playing who? Serbia? At football?
@barneyronay Cool, I'll watch out for it.
@barneyronay Brathwaite, Barney. Where's the thing on Carlos?
@defensivelob If there has to be a haka I always prefer the more traditional Ka Mate one. It reminds me of the great Terry Loader.
Apparently the All Blacks did the 'wrong' haka against us. https://t.co/keCAD1GiwW
Ohio seems to be a toss up at this stage. https://t.co/DWN89Uuvqb
Fun fact: the state of Virginia is actually called the "Commonwealth of Virginia". #Election2016
It would be nice to think that this election is a low point in US politics and it will get better again. https://t.co/ylEO7YzvIH
Impossible to imagine the next president being so bright and energetic after 8 years in office. Or even 4. https://t.co/RAuVvCdzhI
@defensivelob Joe, I know you're always interested in new and useful applications for 3D printing. https://t.co/x8e0YwUiB6
Startling use of the verb "to disclude from" which is a new one to me. https://t.co/SUVQmXvTf0
Fran Rooney (remember him?) says "these are good commemorative issues" so it'll be grand, FIFA. #poppiesrising
@defensivelob You may be getting mixed up. I'm a big fan of Garda Paul Reynolds.
@defensivelob @IrishTimesCultr Extraordinary stuff. Thankfully I remain blissfully ignorant of the goings-on on that show.
@petersuntimes 14-0 down, they were.
@hairyandbrains Amazing stuff. There are still plenty of us around @LeinsterCC who remember Isolda well.
@defensivelob Perhaps. Montpellier will be kicking themselves not to have made this a 5-0 instead of a 4-1. Leinster have a platform now.
@defensivelob Certainly is. Ringrose was brilliant in the second half. Took them on when it was hard to see how Leinster could score.
Luke Fitz's commentary has a few tells if you listen carefully. Watch out for words like 'disappointing', 'hopefully' and 'we'. #MONvLEI
@rorymacm @rocshot I see what you did there, Rory.

@harrymcgee @PatLeahyIT @IrishTimes That's a pity. I like the podcast but not enough to pay for it when so many other good ones available.
@phlaimeaux This isn't what Charles Babbage invented the transistor for.
They might have Bolohan, but we've got Holohan. #MOLIRE
